title: (Pwn2Own) Phoenix Contact CHARX SEC-3100 OCPP Protocol Missing Encryption Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Phoenix Contact CHARX SEC-3100 devices. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the implementation of the OCPP protocol. The issue results from a lack of encryption. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Phoenix Contact has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://cert.vde.com/en/advisories/VDE-2024-011/
timeline:
2024-02-02 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-06-21 - Coordinated public release of advisory
